whether it is form, feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, whether it is apart from form, apart from feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, whether it is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, or whether it is prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, if one seeks in this way, all of them are neither in union nor in disunion, neither having form nor formless, neither having appearance nor without appearance, neither having opposition nor without opposition, all having the same characteristic, which is to say, the characteristic of absence.
